messages.content: Gosh Alex, I need a break! Though I'm having so much fun with Infrahub.
ü§£ Indeed it's Sunday here as well. Were also available to have a call and cover any topics that you may have questions with if needed.

Thank you! I told my colleagues that the response time on Discord is insanely fast‚Ä¶ and it‚Äôs true, so true! üòÑ

And today‚Äôs Sunday in our timezone‚Äîenjoy your weekend, Alex!

Don't forget we have interactive tutorials about schema and artifacts which can be found in the academy section of the docs.https://docs.infrahub.app/academy/getting-started/infrahub-introduction

This will spin up infrahub for you and guide you through

embeds.title: Infrahub Introduction | Infrahub Documentation
embeds.description: A comprehensive introduction to Infrahub, its core concepts, and how it revolutionizes infrastructure management.

messages.content: I would follow the instructions to deploy one of these demos and you will be able to see how it fits together.

The sandbox is indeed laid out very strangely and everything is added via scripts. 

However I would look at two other repos

Firstly demo DC. It's very similar but it's a complete repo: https://github.com/opsmill/infrahub-demo-dc-fabric
Docs: https://docs.infrahub.app/demo/demo-dc-fabric

Also the service catalogue demo is very good.
Docs: https://docs.infrahub.app/demo-service-catalog
https://github.com/opsmill/infrahub-demo-service-catalog

embeds.title: Demo-dc-fabric | Infrahub Documentation
embeds.description: This repository demos key Infrahub features using an example data center running VxLAN / EVPN and firewalls. It demonstrates the capabilities to use Infrahub with Arista AVD and Containerlab. Infrahub generates configurations that AVD deploys to a Containerlab topology.

embeds.title: Home | Infrahub Documentation
embeds.description: A proof of concept for a service catalog using Infrahub and Streamlit.

messages.content:
In my Infrahub learning journey, I‚Äôve noticed that after watching demos and webinars, I tend to refer back to sandbox.infrahub.app to consolidate what I‚Äôve learned and gain a better understanding of the ‚Äúbig picture.‚Äù

However, what‚Äôs missing is a similar reference at the repository level. The closest I could find is this repo: https://github.com/opsmill/infrahub/tree/stable/models/base, but its directory structure isn‚Äôt organized in the typical way one would build it.

Because of this, I struggle to relate anything back to the sandbox app outside of the /base folder. For instance, I was trying to understand how an artifact is created and configured in the sandbox app, but I couldn‚Äôt locate the corresponding .infrahub.yml in the repo.

In short, I‚Äôm learning by reverse-engineering, but without a complete blueprint of the sandbox, my understanding is limited.

Am I looking at the wrong repository?
